Améline Nussbaumer

Instructional Designer and eLearning Producer

CV

A few words about me

Over the past 5 years, I've worked in Learning and Development in international organisations, both in teams and autonomously, helping to provide training solutions to thousands of colleagues and local authorities worldwide. I was involved in various projects including eLearning and blended courses, animated videos, mobile apps, software training, and trainings of trainers. I learned to run a project from start to finish, work with subject matter experts and external providers, and use a range of authoring tools and LMS platforms.

One of the things I love most about working in this field is translating complex topics into simple and engaging content. I also appreciate working in a team with experts and constantly learning about new topics, and having the space to develop both my creativity and technical skills. My biggest motivation is to help people with relevant resources, and, whenever possible, accompany learners along the way.

Taking a break from HQs, I am currently working for a local conservation NGO in Kenya, creating engaging designs to promote the work they do and raising funds to protect threatened habitats and species. Outside of work, you'll find me swimming in the nearest body of water, getting lost in nature with my birder-husband, or cooking/talking about food with friends.

Experience

International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)

Techno-Pedagogical Engineer July 2016 - December 2019

Working in the Learning and Development Division, I managed learning initiatives liaising with internal experts and external providers. Working in the Operations Department, I developed software trainings, conducted trainings of trainers to build internal capacity, and supported the digital transformation of the division.

  • Managed the design and development of trainings in various formats: eLearning, blended, mobile app, face-to-face
  • Produced user-friendly learning resources to facilitate colleagues' adoption and use of new digital tools
  • Delivered training of trainers and regular internal workshops on training practices and digital tools
instructional design eLearning training design eLearning production digital resources

United Nations Institute for Training and Research (UNITAR)

eLearning Officer September 2014 - June 2016

I gained broad experience in the development, promotion and evaluation of online training courses, as well as key skills in project management and communication.

  • Facilitated, translated, and evaluated eLearning courses on Moodle
  • Conducted widespread promotion of eLearning courses on sustainable development
  • Co-organized an international Forum on Public-Private Partnerships (logistics and content)
eLearning facilitation Moodle project management training evaluation communication

How I work

Key principles

Start from learner's needs, keep learner engaged throughout development process. Active learning: practice and see consequences of your actions in a safe space Learn from peers: draw on adults' existing experience and understanding Make online learning as human as possible: communities, forums, group work, facilitation, webinars, etc.

Methodologies

Rapid prototyping: to increase agility and adjust quickly. Action mapping:

Personality

love teamwork, practical/results-oriented, comfortable in multi-cultural contexts, structured mind,

linkedin

Professional Standards for Protection Work

Context - A wide range of protection workers on the field had to be trained on the updated protection standards: they are spread out across the world, work in different organisations, speak various languages, and typically spend a lot of time in the field.

project-management Mohive mobile-app external-provider

Managing Online Communities of Practice

Context - To accompany the launch of a new Communities platform, the aspiring community managers had to be trained in how to launch, facilitate and technically set up and manage their communities.

instructional-design learning-path CrossKnowledge blended-learning

Performance Management and Development

Context - To rapidly develop a training on the new Performance process and tool, there was a need in instructional design and in managing an external provider to produce the modules.

I translated the expert's content into an e-learning scenario including key learning points, practice exercises, and scenarios. I reviewed modules produced by provider.

instructional-design external-provider eLearning

Water and Habitat Data Training

Context - High staff turnover, remote and spread-out locations, and resistance to an old application. There was past training experience of long screen-casting videos to watch, which further disengaged learners.

We created a comprehensive online learning path available anytime, starting with the bigger picture of how this application is useful for the learner ("What's in it for me?"). To maximize engagement, we used a combination of short animated videos and interactive screen-casting tutorials, where learners can practice completing work-based tasks in a safe environment.

software-training eLearning Captivate interactive-module

Economic Security Reporting Landscape

Context - The high number of changes and new tools being introduced created confusion and resistance to anything new or data-related. There was a need for translating complex tpoics into simple and engaging content. With high turnover, staff were spending a lot of time explaining the same processes again and again.

Together with content experts, I scripted and produced whiteboard animation videos summarizing the topic at hand in 5 mins max. Whiteboard animations lend themselves well to progressively explaining complex topics in an engaging and accessible way.

whiteboard-animations video Vyond

Results-based Management in a Nutshell
